Donald Trump claimed during the second p: ICE just endorsed me," referring to the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency endorsing his candidacy.
However: the claim was found to be false as ICE, as a federal agency, cannot formally endorse any presidential candidate.
The National Immigration and Customs Enf: a union representing 5,000 federal immigration officers and law enforcement support staff, did endorse Trump. This endorsement was based on a vote by the membership.
Trump: s claim of ICE endorsement was misleading and exaggerated, as he made it sound like a federal agency had endorsed him, when in reality it was a union representing employees of that agency.
